title: Post Malone’s 2025 Stadium Tour: How to Get Tickets
description: Post Malone is set to embark on his biggest tour to date. Learn how to get sold-out tickets here. Post Malone’s 2025 Stadium Tour: How to Get Tickets Jo Vito
author: Jo Vito
excerpt: Post Malone has announced "The Big Ass Stadium Tour" with Jelly Roll. Learn how to get sold-out tickets and see the full list of dates here.
text: Post Malone has announced a run of 2025 tour dates dubbed “The Big Ass Stadium Tour.” Kicking off in April 2025, the tour will take the rapper-turned-country star to stadiums across North America, with Jelly Roll joining to provide support along the way. Get Post Malone Tickets Here Scroll below for more details, including how to get sold-out tickets, and see the full list of Post Malone’s upcoming tour dates. How Can I Buy Tickets to Attend Post Malone’s 2025 “Big Ass Stadium Tour”? Tickets for Post Malone and Jelly Roll’s 2025 tour are now available via  Ticketmaster. Fans can look for deals or get tickets to sold-out concerts via StubHub, where orders are 100% guaranteed through StubHub’s FanProtect program. StubHub is a secondary market ticketing platform, and prices may be higher or lower than face value, depending on demand. What Is Post Malone’s Next Tour? Dubbed “The Big Ass Stadium Tour,” Post Malone’s 2025 tour dates will be in support of his recently-released debut country album, F-1 Trillion, which was first released this past August and has since received several accolades, including a nomination for Best Country Album at the 2025 Grammys. The tour will kick off in grand style, with Post booked to perform headlining sets at Coachella 2025 in April. From there, “The Big Ass Stadium Tour” itself will launch on April 29th in Salt Lake City, Utah, followed by stops in Las Vegas, Dallas, Atlanta, Chicago, Toronto, and more cities across May. Going into June, the tour will head to Washington DC, New York, Miami, Denver, Seattle, and more, before wrapping with a final date at San Francisco’s Oracle Park on July 1st. Scroll below to see the full list of dates. Who Is Opening for Post Malone on His 2025 Tour? Aptly, “The Big Ass Stadium Tour” will see Posty hit the road with two guest artists from F-1 Trillion: Jelly Roll and Sierra Ferrell. Jelly Roll, a breakout star in recent years, appeared on the F-1 Trillion track “Losers,” and will open for Post at every tour stop except for one in Miami, Florida on June 8th and in Glendale, Arizona on June 21st. As for Ferrell, she featured on the F-1 Trillion cut “Never Love You Again,” and will tag along with the tour for its first month, opening shows in Las Vegas, Atlanta, Chicago, Toronto, Pittsburgh, and more. See which dates she is performing at below. What Are Post Malone’s 2025 Tour Dates? See the full list of Post Malone’s upcoming tour dates below, and grab your tickets here. Post Malone 2025 Tour Dates: 04/13 – Indio, California @ Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival 04/20 – Indio, California @ Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival 2025 04/29 – Salt Lake City, UT @ Rice-Eccles Stadium *^ 05/03 – Las Vegas, NV @ Allegiant Stadium *^ 05/07 – San Antonio, TX @ Alamodome *^ 05/09 – Dallas, TX @ AT&T Stadium *^ 05/11 – Atlanta, GA @ Mercedes Benz Stadium *^ 05/13 – St. Louis, MO @ Busch Stadium *^ 05/18 – Detroit, MI @ Ford Field *^ 05/20 – Minneapolis, MN @ U.S. Bank Stadium *^ 05/22 – Chicago, IL @ Wrigley Field *^ 05/24 – Philadelphia, PA @ Citizens Bank Park *^ 05/26 – Toronto, ON @ Rogers Centre *^ 05/28 – Hershey, PA @ Hersheypark Stadium *^ 05/29 – Pittsburgh, PA @ PNC Park *^ 05/31 – Foxborough, MA @ Gillette Stadium *^ 06/02 – Washington, DC @ Northwest Stadium * 06/04 – New York, NY @ Citi Field * 06/08 – Miami, FL @ Hard Rock Stadium 06/10 – Orlando, FL @ Camping World Stadium * 06/13 – Ridgedale, MO @ Thunder Ridge Nature Arena * 06/15 – Denver, CO @ Empower Field at Mile High * 06/21 – Glendale, AZ @ State Farm Stadium 06/24 – Boise, ID @ Albertsons Stadium * 06/26 – Seattle, WA @ T-Mobile Park * 06/28 – Portland, OR @ Providence Park * 07/01 – San Francisco, CA @ Oracle Park * * = w/ Jelly Roll ^ = w/ Sierra Ferrell
html:
Post Malone has announced a run of 2025 tour dates dubbed “The Big Ass Stadium Tour.”

Kicking off in April 2025, the tour will take the rapper-turned-country star to stadiums across North America, with Jelly Roll joining to provide support along the way.

Get Post Malone Tickets Here

Scroll below for more details, including how to get sold-out tickets, and see the full list of Post Malone’s upcoming tour dates.

How Can I Buy Tickets to Attend Post Malone’s 2025 “Big Ass Stadium Tour”?

Tickets for Post Malone and Jelly Roll’s 2025 tour are now available via  Ticketmaster. Fans can look for deals or get tickets to sold-out concerts via StubHub, where orders are 100% guaranteed through StubHub’s FanProtect program. StubHub is a secondary market ticketing platform, and prices may be higher or lower than face value, depending on demand.

What Is Post Malone’s Next Tour?

Dubbed “The Big Ass Stadium Tour,” Post Malone’s 2025 tour dates will be in support of his recently-released debut country album, F-1 Trillion, which was first released this past August and has since received several accolades, including a nomination for Best Country Album at the 2025 Grammys.

The tour will kick off in grand style, with Post booked to perform headlining sets at Coachella 2025 in April. From there, “The Big Ass Stadium Tour” itself will launch on April 29th in Salt Lake City, Utah, followed by stops in Las Vegas, Dallas, Atlanta, Chicago, Toronto, and more cities across May.

Going into June, the tour will head to Washington DC, New York, Miami, Denver, Seattle, and more, before wrapping with a final date at San Francisco’s Oracle Park on July 1st. Scroll below to see the full list of dates.

Who Is Opening for Post Malone on His 2025 Tour?

Aptly, “The Big Ass Stadium Tour” will see Posty hit the road with two guest artists from F-1 Trillion: Jelly Roll and Sierra Ferrell.

Jelly Roll, a breakout star in recent years, appeared on the F-1 Trillion track “Losers,” and will open for Post at every tour stop except for one in Miami, Florida on June 8th and in Glendale, Arizona on June 21st.

As for Ferrell, she featured on the F-1 Trillion cut “Never Love You Again,” and will tag along with the tour for its first month, opening shows in Las Vegas, Atlanta, Chicago, Toronto, Pittsburgh, and more. See which dates she is performing at below.

What Are Post Malone’s 2025 Tour Dates?

See the full list of Post Malone’s upcoming tour dates below, and grab your tickets here.

Post Malone 2025 Tour Dates:
04/13 – Indio, California @ Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival
04/20 – Indio, California @ Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival 2025
